actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 7152.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. McCormick moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 7152 — "To direct the Secretary of State to establish a national registry of Korean American divided families, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 6586.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. McCormick moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 6586 — "To require a strategy to oppose financial or material support by foreign countries to the Taliban, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of June 25.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

actions-list.header: Commission on the Social Status of Black Men and Boys
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to section 2(b) of the Commission on the Social Status of Black Men and Boys Act (Public Law 116-156), amended by Section 201 of Title II, Division O of the Consolidated Appropriations Act, the Democratic Leader appointed The Honorable Yusef Idris Faadel Salaam, New York, New York.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Mr. Edwards to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of June 25.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Cliff Bentz to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
